alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 11:37AM EDT until September 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms developing over the area with heavy rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over this area from yesterday thunderstorms which has made the grounds saturated. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with these thunderstorms today. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Doral, Hialeah Gardens, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, West Miami, Medley, Miami International Airport, Coral Terrace, Coconut Grove, Marlins Park, Westchester, Gladeview, University Of Miami and Liberty City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
